Hi, I’m Talon.

I’m a third year Ph.D. student studying Medical Physics at the University of Chicago. I’m developing polarized light microscopes with Dr. Patrick La Rivière and Dr. Rudolf Oldenbourg. I’m currently living and working at the Marine Biological Laboratory in Woods Hole, MA.

I graduated from the University of British Columbia in 2015 with a B.A.Sc. in Engineering Physics.

I’m interested in physics, bees, and ultramarathon running.
